comment: Unreachable for the entire 4 week summer course, even when you had dire questions that would impact your grade pass/fail. The syllabus is confusing and contradicting and she won't clarify. If she does email back it's days later than you needed it and one sentence that doesn't answer the question. We got her by mistake, should've dropped.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: For a 4-wk summer course, Stephens was absent for practically the entire month and having to be unsure about your grade on discussions which are 30% of your grade (10% participation, 20% group essay-led one) leads a lot of room for uncertainty. Im sure the course was just from a previous professor in the department and tests are easy As but eh.
She does not give feed back, and hardly ever responds to emails. If you take this teacher be prepared to have to wait weeks to get certain grades back.
10 page paper with a partner, weekly homework, helpful, kind, supportive, learned a ton in this class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: I don't understand all of the negative reviews here; Dr. Stephens is so easy and accommodating. Midterm, quizzes and final are all online. Easy A. Attendance isn't mandatory. Very easy course if you read the text at all. No papers. Highly recommend Dr. Stephens.

Her lectures might be introductory level, but her exams are NOT. She posts her notes online but if you want them to make sense, go to class. The book will help you on exams so make sure you do your readings. She does have pop discussions that are only available in class which make up 15% of the grade. Quiz 20%, Midterm 30%, Final 30%, 5% Attendance
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Wish I had decided to take another professor. Mrs. Stephens was nice but she is very unclear and almost impossible to follow. Her lectures last the entire hour and 15 minutes and would spend weeks on a subject that would only show up a handful of times on the test, which end up being incredibly vague and super difficult to get an A on.

Attendance isn't mandatory but she does random assignments for credit and if you are not in class you get a 0. The class seems easy but tests are hard! They are online but that doesn't make them easy.  She missed 2 weeks of school but she had her sister sub instead of canceling class.

She was actually the worst professor I ever had. If you miss even one class and there was a pop quiz that day, your grade goes down to a 75% in a 30 percent category. She is constantly late and barely covers what is actually on the test. DO NOT TAKE HER FOR THIS COURSE.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She is very sweet, and seems to know her subject very well. However, she uses the whole hour and 15 minutes to lecture, and her lectures can be extremely boring. I just sat there the whole time wishing the class to be over already. Like I said, truly a sweet lady but my goodness extremely monotonous. Her online quiz/tests are hard.

She was very hard to follow during her lectures and the book was not much clearer. However, most of her test questions come straight from the book. (Which you can rent on Amazon btw) I recommend forming a study group to share notes with, and to collaborate during out of class D2L tests. Really not that hard of a class, but make friends early on!

I would not recommend her if you take online. She is very picky about assignments. Gives all  group work that sometimes is very time consuming. If you get delt a bad group oh well all the work falls on you. 2 test, midterm and final very easy if you study 24hrs a day. Never responds to emails, and waits till end of semester to grade everything.
She's alright. Not the best but not the worst either. Weekly discussion boards, one discussion leader post, midterm, final, and extra credit (optional). Textbook reading is a must so buy the text.
The subject was boring, but the professor was pretty good.  Easy to pass the tests, all quizzes/tests are online.  We had one group presentation.
Best Professor I've had so far.
Summer Course. Keeps you busy.  Professor very helpful.  Just obey instructions.

Kinda' hard to understand what she wants, as her English doesn't seem that great via webct (banner). As this was an online only class. My main problem was that she didn't grade anything 'till the end, so you had no idea if your posts were good. Weekly posts, one giant paper, and a couple goofy assignments. At least her exams were MC, not essay.

This professor was pretty good at explaining the basic theories, and the class was very easy. BUT. The professor also taught misinformation about feminism and sex/gender, which is often a problem but unacceptable in a sociology prof. After I receive my grade I plan to talk directly to the prof about it & I'll edit this then to include the response.

I loved Dr. Stephens, her class is very interesting and she has a vast knowledge of the subject. I did all the readings for her class and found the tests very easy. She does talk a lot though and sometimes gets off subject
I took her online this summer. She is very good but the problem with her is that it will take awhile to respond back. You have to study the text book and notes. I am glad I passed the class Goodluck.

I took online class.  She is a nice instructor, but definately teaches at a very high level for an intro class.  Exams are hard and she doesn't give feedback on discussion points/grades earned until the end of the semester.  I liked her but class is very difficult.
The questions on the exam are equivalent to graduate level questions.  Expect to have trouble with many of them, even when you know the material well.  Too time consuming.
Be prepared to study hard and still have trouble answering the exam questions.

She expects too much of your time in the online class.  She asks for one post per week, but really wants multiple posts per week, which must be really in depth or you might as well not do them.  About half of the questions on her exams are tricky, so that you are questioning yourself even if you studied well.  You can make an A, but it's hard.
Great teacher took her online class.  Very prepared and got great and prompt feedback.
